events.event_description: Arrival and Registration of Delegates/Tea Break

moderators: Mr Asue Ighodalo – Chairman, Alaghodaro – Edo State Investment Summit

events.event_description: Documentary – Edo Before, Now and into the Future

moderators: His Excellency, President of Federal Republic of Nigeria, Muhammadu Buhari, GCFR

special_guests: Minister for Budget and National Planning

events.event_description: Plenary I: Edo Sate: Nigeria’s Best Kept Secret
events.full_details: In building a globally competitive State Economy, Edo State must identify, define and harness its competitive advantages in terms of economic, socio-political, cultural, environmental, technological and geographical factor conditions for sustainable economic growth. A stable macroeconomic environment promotes productivity. A synergy between Federal and Sub-national economic reform policies to create Edo State Investment Climate attractiveness is the key to sustainable, inclusive economic growth and development. This plenary explores the best kept secrets to unlocking economic opportunities, industrialisation and jobs in Edo State.
moderators: Ike Chioke – GMD, Afrinvest (West Africa) Limited
special_guests: His Excellency, Godwin Obaseki, Executive Governor of Edo State

events.event_description: Plenary II: Institutional Reforms – Doing things differently
events.full_details: A crucial element for improving Edo State Investment Climate and Attractiveness is Institutional Reforms that are targeted an improving the Ease of Doing Business. The strategic intent of the Edo Government is to create and sustain a regulatory environment that is more conducive to start and operate a local firm in Edo State. This plenary will explore the range of strategic reforms that are crucial to achieving Sub-National Competitiveness. It will provide a platform for dealing with the significant institutional arrangements that need to be put in place to meet some of the World Bank’s existing ease of doing business measures(Indicators) which are: Starting a Business, Construction Permits, Registering Property and Enforcing Contracts and some Home-grown measures like: Security, Infrastructure, Regulatory Environment, Investment Promotion, Open Government Reforms etc.
panelists: Oladapo Afolabi fmr. HOS of Federation

events.event_description: Plenary III: ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT (Session I: Edo Agro-Industrial Revolution and Agribusiness Transformation)
events.full_details: The economic potential of Edo Agriculture Sector as a key driver of non-oil lead growth, industrial productivity and employment in key national strategic crops is central to the Edo Development Agenda. Noting the significant deficits in food systems in scaling agribusiness primary production leveraging input efficiencies, expanding primary processing capabilities, this plenary will be a platform for exploring a new Edo State Agro-Industrial model for inclusive wealth creation, bringing stakeholders together and incubating innovation for Building the Competitiveness of Edo State Agribusiness. The plenary will examine a broad range of effective strategies for fixing agriculture value chains and agribusiness financing value chains; aligning private sector, public sector and development partner investments to achieve commodity-to-Market competitiveness in Edo State agriculture sector. This will include a focus on integrated Edo State Commodity value chains access to and competitiveness in Markets, agricultural Finance transformation through rethinking Risk Governance in Edo State.
panelists: Mukul Mathur (Country head OLAM Nigeria Ltd)
Chief E. I Odigie (President, Association of Edo Farmers)

events.event_description: Plenary III: ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT (Session II: Infrastructure Development Imperatives of Edo Economic Development Agenda)
events.full_details: Critical Infrastructure are fundamental factor conditions and enablers of the Competitive Advantage Development of Edo State across all its economic sectors and is a prerequisite for meaningful transformation and economic development. This plenary will explore and examine the cross-cutting issues to attracting investments into Edo State Infrastructure Development, the complexities of Federal-State Infrastructure Corridor Development and the central role of Infrastructure Investment Packaging and Promotion through Public-Private Partnerships.
panelists: Chidi Izuwa Snr. (Ag. DG/CEO Infrastructure Regulatory Commission)

events.event_description: Plenary III: ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT (Session III: Manufacturing)
Plenary III: ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT (Session IV: Inventors & Innovators)

Oswald Osaretin Guobadia (Exe. VP, DBH Solutions)
